column1: Janet's duck lays 16 eggs a day, she eats three eggs for breakfast every day, and she uses four eggs to make a muffin for her friends every day, she sells the rest of the eggs at the farmers market every day for $2 per pound of fresh duck eggs, how much money does she make from the farmers market per day?
A robe is made of two strips of blue cloth and half of the white cloth is made of blue cloth. How many strips of the same cloth are there in a robe?
Josh decided to try to buy the house to fix it up for resale, so he bought it for $80,000 and spent $50,000 on the renovation, which increased the value of the house by 150%.
James decided to run three sets of short runs three times a week, running 60 meters each set, and how many meters did he run in a week?

Wendy feeds her chickens regularly every day with three bowls of chicken feed, each consisting of seeds, worms and vegetables to help her chickens stay healthy, she divides the feed into three meals, in the morning she feeds 15 bowls, in the afternoon she feeds another 25 bowls, if Wendy's chickens in the coop have a total of 20, how many bowls should she feed the chickens in the last meal of the day?
So, Claire goes to the store to buy glasses for her new apartment, and one glass costs $5 but the second glass will only cost 60% of the full price.
Toulouse has twice as many sheep as Charleston, Charleston has four times as many sheep as Seattle, if Seattle has 20 sheep, how many sheep do Toulouse, Charleston and Seattle have combined?

Carla is downloading a 200 GB file, normally she can download 2 GB/min, but after 40% of the download, Windows is forced to restart and install the update, which takes 20 minutes, then Carla has to start downloading the file again from the beginning.

John spent three hours driving at 60 miles an hour, then turned back because he remembered he had forgotten something very important at home. He tried to get home in four hours, but the car hit the stop sign for the first two hours. Half an hour later, he drove at 30 miles an hour, before reaching 80 miles an hour for the remaining four hours. At the end of the four hours, he was still how many miles away from home?

Elisa's hourly rate for the first 40 hours of work each week was $10 and she was paid overtime at 1.2 times her regular hourly rate. If Elisa worked 45 hours this week, her earnings for this week would be $1.

The new program, one of the programs, had 60 downloads in the first month, the second month's downloads were three times higher than the first month's, but the third month's downloads were down 30 percent.
She went to a bakery and bought a bunch of bread, she bought three doughnuts for $68 a can, two cupcakes for $80, and six cupcakes for $55.
Carlos grew a lemon tree for $90. The lemon tree would produce seven lemons a year, which he could sell for $1.50 a lemon. The cost of watering and fertilizing the lemon tree was $3 a year.
Melanie is a door-to-door salesperson, and she sold one-third of the vacuum cleaners in the green house, sold two more in the red house, and sold half of the remaining number in the orange house.

A dance class, which is 20 students, 20 percent of the students are in contemporary dance, 25 percent of the students are in jazz, and the rest of the students are in hip-hop, and the hip-hop is the percentage of the students.

A trader has to choose between two plans: jewelry for $5,000 or electronics for $8,000. His financial advisor estimates that the jewelry market will increase in value by 2.5% and the electronics market will increase in value by 1.2% within the same month. If the trader wants to choose the most profitable plan by the end of the month, how many dollars will the trader make?
Two trains leave San Rafael at the same time, both trains start heading west for 80 miles, the next day both trains head north for a combined 150 miles.

Jill is paid $20 an hour as a teacher and $30 an hour as a cheerleading coach, so if in a year she works 50 weeks, 35 hours a week as a teacher and 15 hours a week as a coach, she's going to make four dollars a year.
Claire makes three egg omelets for breakfast every day for four weeks, how many dozen eggs will she eat?

Marissa walks a 12-mile forest trail, completing the first four miles in one hour and completing the next two miles in another hour. If she wants to keep her average speed at four miles per hour, how fast (in miles per hour) does she have to walk for the rest of the distance?

I have 10 liters of orange juice, which is two-thirds water, and I want to fill this with 15 liters of lemon juice, which is three-fifths water, but as I pour the orange juice, I make six liters of orange juice, and I'm going to dilute how many liters of water from the remaining 24 liters of fruit juice.
Raymond and Samantha are cousins, Raymond was born six years before Samantha, Raymond had a son when he was 23, if Samantha is now 31, how many years ago was Raymond's son born?
Billy sold a DVD on Tuesday, he had eight customers, the first three customers bought one DVD, the next two customers bought two, the last three customers didn't buy a single DVD.
A single candle will melt two centimeters per hour. If the candle is lit from 1 p.m. to 5 p.m., how many centimeters will the candle shorten?
Kyle bought last year's bestseller for $19.50, which is 25% off the original price.
Mary ordered a $12 chicken dish, five packs, three packs, four apples, $1.50 each, and a number of pizzas. Mary paid the entire $50 bill. If the pizza was $8.50, how many pizzas did Mary order?

Michka bought three shorts, three long pants, and three pairs of shoes: one shorts for $16.50, one long pants for $22.50, and one pair of shoes for $42. How many dollars did Michka spend on all the clothes?
Cynthia eats one cup of ice cream every night, she buys 15 boxes of ice cream that she can eat, $4.00 a box, and after 60 days, how many dollars will she spend on all of the ice cream?
Henry stopped twice during his 60-mile bike trip, he stopped once after 20 miles and then stopped again 15 miles before the end of the trail.

Gloria is shopping for shoes and finds a pair of boots that fits her budget, but she has to choose between a pair of boots and two pairs of high heels that are combined and are cheaper than five-dollar boots. If one pair of high heels costs $33 and the other is twice as expensive, the boots will cost a few dollars.
If the ages of Darrell and Allen are 7:11 apart, if they're 162 years old now, calculate Allen's age in 10 years.

So Gunther is trying to count jelly beans in dozens, and he asks his friends to guess how many jelly beans are in a dozen. One friend says 80 jelly beans, another says more than half as many as the first person, 20 jelly beans, the third says more than the first person, 25 percent, on average, and the friends guess how many jelly beans are in the dozen.
John takes care of 10 dogs, one of which spends .5 hours a day walking and doing personal chores, and how many hours a week does John spend taking care of dogs?
Gretchen has $110 in gold, with more than 30 silver coins.
So Shobhan has less jewels than Aaron, two seeds. Aaron has more than half the jewels that Raymond has five. If Raymond has 40 seeds, Shobhan has how many seeds?
Mike played 40 minutes of ping-pong, and in the first 20 minutes, he scored four points, and in the next 20 minutes, he scored 25 percent more points, and how many points did he score?
Terry's two yogurts a day, which is now down to four yogurts, $5.00 over 30 days, and he's spending a dollar on yogurt.

John was going to sell all his toys and use the money to buy video games. He had 13 sets of Lego and sold them for $15 each. He ended up buying eight video games for $20 each and $5 left. How many sets of Lego did he have left?
John runs 60 miles a week, three days a week, on the first day he runs for three hours, and the other two days he runs for half a day each, on the first day he runs at what, miles an hour?

Dana can run at four times the speed of walking, but she can jump at half the speed of running. If she can jump at three miles an hour, how many miles can she travel in six hours if she spends one-third of her time running and two-thirds of her time walking?
Brandon's iPhone is four times older than Ben's iPhone, Ben's iPhone is twice as old as Susie's iPhone, and if Susie's iPhone is a year old, how old is Brandon's iPhone?

Perg, the great dragon, sits atop Farbo Hill, and it blows fire at everything from 1,000 feet. Polly can throw a golden axe. The only known weapon to defeat a dragon is a 400-foot fire, which is within the range of the dragon's flame. But when Polly holds a kite, she can throw the kite three times as far as she can.

Grandma Jones baked five slices of apple pie for the fireman's lunch, she cut each slice into eight pieces and placed these five slices on the buffet table for guests to eat themselves, and when the service was over, after the guests had eaten their own slices, there were 14 slices left.

From the dietary data, it's 250 calories per unit consumption for one bag of french fries. If it's 300 grams of french fries, there are five units of consumption, how many grams of french fries can you eat if you have a calorie target of 2,000 calories per day and you've already gotten 1,800 calories.

Charlie wants to sell a candle made of beeswax, and a pound of beeswax can make 10 copies, and a pound of beeswax with candles costs $10. If he sells a candle for $2.00, he'll make a dollar profit if he sells 20 copies.

Meredith is a freelance blogger who writes about health and delivers to clients every day as a regular job. One blog post takes an average of four hours to research and write. Last week, she wrote five posts on Monday, and two-fifths as many on Tuesday.

Candice grabs 80 sheets of postcards, puts them in a briefcase, and goes to work at a coffee shop. On the way, she stops at a store and buys a pack of postcards. On the way, she puts one sheet of postcards on a 220-ounce cup of coffee. If she has 23 sheets left, how many sheets of postcards did she buy?
John buys twice as many red ties as blue ties, red ties are 50% more expensive than blue ties, he pays $200 for blue ties, which cost $40 each.
Tracy uses a four-foot-long line to cut the tomato trees in the garden into six-inch-long lines.
Richard lives in a 15-story apartment building, each floor has eight units, and three-quarters of the units are occupied.
Lloyd owns an egg farm, and his eggs lay 252 pounds a day, which he sells for $2 a dozen.
Tom's boat sails at 10 miles an hour, he sails from 1 to 4 and then he sails back at 6 miles an hour.
Uriah's bag was getting too heavy for him, he needed to take off 15 pounds, his comic books were a quarter of a pound, and his toys were a half a pound.

The repairman charges different rates for truck and car tires, for a truck tire, he charges $60 per line, and for a car tire, he charges $40 per line on Thursdays, six truck tires and four truck tires on Fridays, 12 truck tires and no truck tires on higher-earning days, how many dollars more per day?

While the Datefires were driving home with seven kittens they had adopted from a local shelter, their mother called to say that two of the cats had just given birth, and she said that the first one, Patchy, had three times as many kittens as the other, Trixie, had 12 kittens.
China has 30 smiles, China eats two smiles, China wants to put the rest of the smiles in bags, two bags each, how many bags of smiles will China share?
Peter is going to the movies this week, he usually buys tickets for $7 and popcorn for $7. If he had $42 this week, how many times could he go to the movies?

A wooden bridge can only hold a maximum of 5000 pounds. A transport truck carrying the same box, each weighing 15 pounds, will drive across the bridge. If the total weight of the driver and the empty truck is 3755 pounds, the maximum number of boxes that the car can carry without exceeding the weight limit of the bridge is equal to how many boxes?

Stephen ordered the invoice online, the total amount was $40.00 because he ordered through the shipping service, so the service charged him 25% of his total amount and charged him a $3.00 delivery fee. Stephen also added a $4.00 tip after adding all the additional fees.
A single raspberry tree has six berries, 20 of them, and there are 67 individual berries scattered throughout the tree, so how many raspberries are there?
A leaf of tomato has 25 oranges, which contains 1 rotten orange, 20% uncooked orange, 2 pickled orange and the rest are sweet oranges. How many sweet oranges are there?
Janet bought her daughter a necklace, she paid $500 for the material, and she paid $800 for the jeweler, and then she paid 10% of the premium on the necklace, so she paid what, $500?
If Marcie works for the same company for 40 years, she gets a $50,000 annual pension, and from the 20th year on, she's entitled to a 5% annual pension on top of that.

Alina subscribes to a streaming service that charges $140 per month, so if the streaming company charges the same as above for the first quarter, then the charge is reduced by 10% for the second quarter, so you can calculate the total amount she paid for the streaming service at the end of the year.

So Sophia was going to take her car on a road trip, and she wanted to know how many miles a tank of gas would go after the last full tank of gas, and she had driven 100 miles, and she needed to fill up four gallons of gas to fill up again, and her driver's manual said that her tank had 12 gallons of gas, so how many miles would Sophia drive per tank of gas?
Jim spent two hours watching TV, then decided to lie in bed reading for half of that time, and he did this three times a week for four weeks.

Four schools competed in the basketball tournament, each school sent one women's basketball team and one men's basketball team, each team consisting of five players, each school also sent a coach to the other team.
A treasure hunter found a treasure chest full of hidden gems, in a chest of 175 diamonds, 35 less diamonds and twice as much marble.
Dr. Weitz's school has twice as many boys as girls. If the school has 60 girls and one teacher for every five students, how many teachers does the school have?

Bailey had a certain amount of money, and then she got a weekly allowance of $5 a week for eight weeks, so if she had $100 at the end of eight weeks, how many dollars did Bailey have at the beginning?
Judy teaches five dance classes on weekdays and eight classes on Saturdays. If each class has 15 students, and she pays $15.00 per person for a week, how many dollars does Judy make?
Keeley has two recipes for cooking, one with 20 steps, and the second with twice as many steps.
Tommy is raising money for charity by selling $3 brownies and $4 cheesecakes. If Tommy sells 43 brownies and 23 cheesecakes, how many dollars does Tommy raise?
Sheila bought a $150 cell phone, divided into three months, each phone charged 2% interest, so in three months, how many dollars would Sheila have to pay per month?

Artie had a flower board at the farmers' market, and he sold three flowers: rose, peony, and begonia. Normally, he sold rose bushes for $2.74, rose bushes for $1.87, and begonias for $2.12, but today, Artie didn't have a ton of money, so he decided to subtract the price of all the flowers. If Artie sold 12 rose bushes, nine peony bushes, and 17 begonias, how many dollars would he get?

Luke finally built a sand castle on the beach, and he noticed that each sand castle had less space than the one below half a square foot. If he built a four-story sand castle with a 16-square-foot top floor, how many square feet would each floor average?

Cecilia just got a new puppy, and her vet said she's going to feed the puppy one cup of food a day for the first 180 days, then two cups of food a day for the rest of her life, so if one dog food bag is 110 cups of food, how many bags of dog food will Cecilia need to use in the first year?
If Raymond is one-half the size of Sarah, and Sarah is four times the size of David, then calculate the difference between Raymond's and David's laundry in the case of Sarah's 400 pounds.
Vincent could buy three bouquets for $2.50 or two bouquets for $1 if he bought 18 flowers at a lower price, how many dollars would he save?
John gets one of the doggy kits, he gets a $100 haircut, but the barber shop gives 30% off for new customers, so how much is a doggy haircut?
Two girls each pour one sixth of a pint, then the other boy pour six, and finally, how many liters of water are left?

Charlie had 10 stickers, he bought 21 stickers from the store in the mall, and he got 23 stickers for his birthday, and then Charlie gave nine stickers to his sister, and he used 28 stickers to decorate the greeting card.
Grace weighs 125 pounds, Alex weighs four times less than Grace's 2 pounds, how many pounds do they both weigh?
So, if you plant three rose bushes, each one will produce 25 flowers, each flower will have eight thorns, and how many thorns will there be in the rose?
The football team played 22 games, winning more than losing eight. How many games did the football team win in total?

Gene brings a souvenir shirt to the shop, and he buys a souvenir shirt every time he goes on vacation, and each shirt is in his own souvenir block, and each row of souvenirs is made up of a souvenir block from each year's vacation.

Greg set the alarm clock to use a memory three times a day, and when the alarm clock went off, the alarm clock would go off until Greg shut it down. The first alarm clock went off four times today, the second alarm clock went off three times longer than the first, the third alarm clock went off half the second, and then how many times did the clock go off?

The company pays employees $600 a month, and the company has a policy of increasing the salary of employees by 10% of the starting salary each year if the employee has been with the company for five years. If Sylvie has been with the company for five years as of last December, Sylvie will receive a total salary for the entire year after three more years of service.
Marilyn's first single sold 10 times more than the Herald's. If Marilyn's song sold 88,000 copies, how much did the Herald sell?

Christina is planning a birthday party and has to spend 0.75 gift bags per guest invited, since 1/4 of the invited guests did not attend, Christina has invited 16 friends, gift bags cost $2 each, how much will she have to pay?

Ted the Thyrex is planning to bring potato salad to a dinosaur picnic, and he knows that one adult dinosaur will eat 10 pounds of potato salad, and one baby dinosaur will eat half as much salad as one adult dinosaur, so if there are 20 adult dinosaurs and five baby dinosaurs, how many pounds of potato salad does he need to bring to the picnic if he wants to have enough for all the dinosaurs?
Jane has three times as many pets as Marcia, and Marcia has two more pets than Cindy, so if Cindy has four pets, how many pets will all three of them have in total?

Emily has four children, Amy Jackson, Corey, and James. Amy is five years older than Jackson and two years younger than Corey. If James is ten years old and one year younger than Corey, how old is Jackson?

Lee used to run the 400 meters two seconds faster than Gerald, but Gerald changed his diet to lose weight, making him 10% faster. If Lee ran the 400 meters in 38 seconds, Gerald, who went through a weight-loss diet, would be able to run the 400 meters in a few seconds.

In a neighborhood, there are more than a dozen pet rabbits than there are cats and dogs combined. If there are twice as many cats as there are dogs, and there are 60 dogs in that neighborhood, how many pets are there in total?
There are 200 fifth graders, two-fifths of whom are boys, and two-thirds of whom are girls, and how many girls are girls?
Last night, Harrenon slept nine hours, and his friend James slept only two-thirds of the time.

When Frida brings the tomatoes to make the sauce, the tomatoes are halved, each tomato she uses is 16 ounces, and each tomato has three tomatoes, and the last tomato sauce Frida made was 32 ounces, so how many tomatoes did Frida use?

On the freeway, there are cars following each other in a line, some of them moving through traffic jams in the first 15 minutes, then 20 cars moving through in the last 15 minutes of traffic jams, and five cars in a line using the exit so that they don't have to move through traffic jams.

Mary is a passionate gardener, and yesterday she received 18 new trees from her favorite nursery, along the windowsills of 40 of her country houses, where there are already two trees on each window, and out of a sense of sharing, she decided to give one tree on each window-sill to her friends and family, and tomorrow, Mary will have a few trees left.

Jerome had four friends come to visit on some days, the first friend knocked on the door 20 times before Jerome opened it, the second friend knocked on the door a quarter more than Jerome's first friend, the third friend knocked on the door 10 times more than the fourth friend, and if the fourth friend knocked on the door 60 times, how many times was the door knocked on?

Solo had to read four pages of science textbooks, 20 pages of social studies textbooks, seven pages of history textbooks, and eight pages of geography textbooks on Monday. Solo read 15 pages of books. If he had four days to read each page, how many pages would he have to read on an average day?

John would drink a glass of water with his breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and then he would drink another glass of water before he went to bed, which John would do every day, but on the weekends, he would relax and drink soda with dinner instead.

The fog lines from the ocean move in and cover the city, taking 10 minutes to cover the city every three miles. If the city is 42 miles from the ocean shore and sits on the opposite bank on a hill, the fog will cover the entire city in minutes.
Poppy is doing 1,000 jigsaws, she's doing a quarter of the total on the board, then her mother is doing a third of the remaining number, and then how many more jigsaws are left?
Cody ate three times as many cookies as Aamir. If Aamir ate five cookies, how many cookies did they both eat?
John has three boxes, each box is 5 inches by 6 inches by 4 inches, the sides of the boxes are 1 inch thick, what is the total volume inside the three boxes?

Every night, Frankie watches TV after he's done his homework, and on Mondays and Tuesdays, he watches his favorite hour-long show, one episode each night, on Wednesdays, he watches a 30-minute show, a few episodes, on Thursdays, he finishes his homework early, and then he watches an hour-long show, one episode, and then another 30-minute show, and on Fridays, he can sleep in late because he's off on the weekends, so he watches two hour-long shows, if he watches seven hours of TV in total, and on Saturdays, he watches a 30-minute show, how many episodes?

Henry was making cookies for the local bake-off, and he wanted to make twice as many cookies as he had made last year, and when he finished baking, he realized he had made 15 more cookies, and he made five cookies while he was taking them out to cool down, and now he had 110 cookies.

A local gas station owner is selling gas at $3.00 a gallon, and the app development company is offering a $0.20 a gallon refund if you fill up at this pump, and if you buy 10 gallons of gas, how much will that be after the refund?

Marcel and Beatrice were competing to see who could eat the most rolls of dried fruit, so they both scooped up as many rolls of dried fruit as they could find, but someone made a mistake. Beatrice's rolls were two by 24 while Marcel's were three by 14. If both of them ate all the rolls of dried fruit, how much would they eat on average?

Julia's boat broke while she was in the lake, and for every ten feet she went back to shore, two liters of water flowed into the boat. It took Julia sixteen seconds to sail twenty feet, and the shore was 64 seconds away.

A classroom has a whiteboard that is shared by four teachers who are in turn using the classroom, each teacher teaching two classes a day, and in each class using the whiteboard. If in each class the whiteboard is deleted three times in a day, how many times is the whiteboard deleted?
Ryan plants two flowers a day in his garden, and after 15 days, how many flowers will he have if five flowers don't grow?

Jamal's phone has six times the photographic capacity of a British phone, and the British phone has 50 times the photographic capacity of the ducks in Jamal's photos of the zoo. If Jamal's phone has 1,800 photos, how many ducks can be seen in Jamal's photos of the zoo?

Sasha noticed that the price of wood had gone up by 50% in the last few months after she bought some of the wood, because she had some leftover wood, so she decided to sell it, and she had 10 pieces of wood, 2 x 4 x 10, for $10 each, and she also had five pieces of wood, 4 x 4 x 10, for $16 each.

Kate brews coffee using sugar units as teaspoons and water units as glasses in the ratio 7:13. If the number of teaspoons of sugar and the number of glasses of water she uses add up to 120, then calculate how many teaspoons of sugar she uses.
John bought three children two pairs of shoes for $60 each.

The customs officer at the main port of the SeaSide duty-free zone counts two cargo trunks with five vehicles on each side, and the next day adds another one, and the total number of vehicles at the port becomes 30.

Adrian's total salary is 30% more than Layla's total salary. Then four years later, Adrian's salary is up, and he's earning more than he ever did four years ago, 40% if both Adrian and Layla's salary were up together, and four years ago, Adrian earned $40,000, so let's calculate the total salary they both earned four years later.
Miguel uses two sheets of drawing paper a week. If each sheet has 30 sheets, how many sheets does he use in each month?
Morrigan and Kyle were asked to bring fruit. Morrigan bought five apples and eight oranges, and Kyle bought twice as many apples and half as many oranges. How many fruits would they have together?

Sadeen eight hours on Monday, and then the next two days, she sleeps two hours less every night because she has to finish her assignment, and then the rest of the week, if she sleeps more than two hours, how many hours does she sleep in a week?
Rosie can run 10 miles an hour for three hours, then she runs 5 miles an hour, how many miles can Rosie run in seven hours?
Jenny is helping in her mother's office, and she has 60 boxes of stamps to be stamped, and one box of stamps that have been stamped, and she stamps a third of the letters that have to be stamped.

Julia was preparing food for a dinner party at her house, where she was going to make a stew, and she found that she didn't have a plastic spoon, so she bought a new pack of spoons. Later, her husband bought five different packs of spoons for Julia, one for each of them. While Julia was cooking the stew, she used three spoons to make the stew, and then when she set the table, she had 12 spoons. How many spoons were in the pack that Julia had bought?
Dylan had to use chicken and fish crackers to make the chicken breads at the party, and he bought 38 chicken crackers, and he bought more fish crackers than he had six chicken crackers.
After moving to a new school, Amy has 20 more friends than Lily has, if Lily has 50 friends, how many friends do Lily and Amy have together?

Well, his mother sells tangos, sweet potatoes, and oranges at the local store, but one of the oranges costs three times the price of the sweet potatoes, one of the oranges costs less than the tangos, which is $5 -- so Dylan comes to the store to buy four tangos, 20 sweet potatoes, and 10 oranges, and he has to pay the full amount if the sweet potatoes cost $15 each.

One hospital has 500 patients coming in every day, and each patient is seen for an average of 24 minutes, and the doctor charges the hospital $150 an hour, and the hospital charges the patient $200 an hour, and how much profit does the hospital make from these patients seeing the doctor?

Nyssa hired 60 seasonal workers to play Santa Claus' village elves in her mall, one-third of the elves quit after being nauseated by the kids, then 10 of the rest quit after being slapped in the face by the kids.
Joseph had $500 in May, he had $60 less in June.

Pam and Fred went to a theme park during the festival, Pam played two rounds of roller coasters, Fred played four rounds of roller coasters, and then they decided to play two rounds of car games, each of them playing a game where they had to buy six tickets.

On Mondays, Walt walks four miles; on Tuesdays, he walks six times the distance he walked on Mondays; from Monday to Wednesday, he walks a total of 41 miles; on Wednesdays, how many miles does he walk?
Tom washes his car four times a month. If each car wash costs $15 how much does he pay for a year?
Bobby, Brian's friend, has three times fewer video games than Brian has five. If Brian has 20 video games, but loses five before the comparison, how many video games does Bobby have?
There are 27 unicorns left in the world, and one-third of them are in the Scottish Highlands, and two-thirds of the unicorns in Scotland are female.

Rory ordered two long-form sandwiches for $7.50 each, two bags of fries for $1.50 each, and two cookies for $1.00 each to be delivered to her home, while she paid for the 20% delivery fee and she wanted an extra $5.00 tip.

Yesterday, Mark took a test that had 75 questions, he took it at a rate of five questions per hour, today he took another test with 100 questions, and he took the same rate of answering. If Mark had eight hours to do the first test and six hours to do the second test, how many questions would Mark have left to do?
In the coin-shaped box, there are four times as many pink potatoes as there are blue ones, 22 of them. If there are 12 blue potatoes, how many pink potatoes are there in the box?
In the 20-car rental line, 12 cars are automatic, four are regular, and the rest are semi-automatic.
There are 700 bees in the hive, twice as many worker bees as there are honeybees, and twice as many honeybees as there are bees.

Jordan plays video games for two hours a day, and he also works part-time for $10 an hour. How much money would Jordan make in a week if he took his time playing video games and put it into part-time work?

John bought two dollars of eggs, three dollars of lamps, three dollars of cups, three dollars of pots, and four dollars of insect traps. If there is a 10% tax on all non-food items, what is the total value of all items?

Kim started a housecleaning business and was calculating the profit he would make from each customer. He already had three customers, but he was talking to five potential customers, and he was confident enough to include these five in the profit calculation. Each customer's home would use two bottles of bleach and one pack of cleaning cloths.
John has 10 hectares of citrus groves, and each hectare has 100 citrus trees, and John can harvest citrus every three months.

Johnny was putting his toys on the floor in his room, and before he had put 500 Lego boxes on the floor, and then three Lego sets of 500 Lego sets, and then one Lego set of four, how many Lego sets did Johnny put on the floor?

Debra was checking the hives to see how many bees were coming in and out of the hive in a day, and she saw 30 bees leave the hive in the first six hours, and then she saw half of all the bees leave and come back in the next six hours, and she saw twice as many bees as she had seen leave the hive in the first six hours, and then all the bees that had left before and hadn't come back in the next six hours, and how many bees were returned to the hive in the last six hours of the day.

Brittany and her mother went to visit the museum. Admission was $12 for adults and $10 for children. Brittany's mother paid the cashier for one child and one adult. If she got an $8 allowance, how many dollars did she give to the cashier?
Charlie has three times as many Facebook friends as Dorothy, James has four times as many Facebook friends as Dorothy. If Charlie has 12 Facebook friends, how many Facebook friends does James have?

Steve and Tim decided to compete to see who could get home from school faster. Steve's home was farther away than Tim's, so he was allowed to ride a bike. Steve was three miles from school and could cycle at 440 feet per minute, and Tim was two miles from school.

So Shaunda saw that the kids in the neighborhood would definitely want to use a tire-cleaning service, and she decided that the best way to charge for the service was by the number of tires, and the cost of each tire was 25 cents. The first day, five cyclists were cleaning two tires, and three were cleaning all three tires of the three-wheeler.
Carl bought ten packs of cookies, each packet with six cookies inside, each cookie cost $0.10 how much money would Carl get if he paid with a $10 bill?

Dave bought a big bag of French fries and ate 14 of them before a hungry gull stole them from his hand. When the gull flew to the ground, he ate half of them. Then three pigeons came and chased the gull away from the food, and each dove took three of the fries. Then the raccoon stole two-thirds of the fries, and then he stole the last one, and there were five left.

On Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, Kyomo, as a student, attends three classes a day, each one an hour long, and on Tuesdays and Thursdays, he attends two classes a day, each two hours long, for a 16-week semester. Kyomo spends four hours with the class.
Bill would have 300 rolls of bread, 120 chocolate bars, and 60 baskets of bread every day, each roll four inches long, each square six inches long, and each basket two feet long.

The keeper feeds all the monkeys in the zoo, and every two months he orders all the bananas from the local garden. If in a month the monkey wants 200 bananas, the gorilla wants 400 bananas, and the baboon wants 100 bananas, he has to order how many bananas, so that's enough for two months.

Belg and Kelly competed to see who could run the longest in 15 minutes, and they decided to compete on a 100-yard football field. Belg ran back and forth 15 times, Kelly ran back and forth once, and then decided she didn't want to run next to Belg. Belg started running to the 40-yard line and then ran back and forth, doing this 34 times, the winner running farther than any loser.
Rafael went out to buy school supplies, he bought pens for $1.5 each, four pens, two notebooks for $4 each, and a good quality paper for $20 each.

Finn sees 11 eggs swimming in the pond, and then he sees six eggs in a group coming out of the hole under the well, and then he sees two eggs in a group going under the rock, and now Finn is going to see how many eggs in the pond.
One tank was 17 feet deep on Monday, then on Tuesday it was seven feet deep, and on Wednesday it was two-thirds of what it was on Tuesday.
Today Anakin and Loxin went to the beach, Anakin caught 10 trout, 6 salmon, and 3 trout, and Loxin caught less than 5 trout, less than 3 salmon, and more than 2 salmon.
If a glass bag costs $20 and the price goes up 20% from the original price every two months, what would a glass bag cost after 36 months?
In the room, there are all kinds of toys: five red cars, three action figures, and one doll, which is worth three action figures, and the red car is worth $4 each.

Jackie was trying to decide whether to file her own taxes or hire an accountant. If she filed her own taxes, she would have three fewer hours of freelance work, costing her $35 an hour. The accountant charged $90 if she hired an accountant to file her taxes.

Elvira chose a new computer with a lot of accessories as a 30th birthday present. She had a budget of €1,500 that everyone in her family had collectively given her, and she thought she had a little money left over to buy clothes. She went to a computer store and chose a computer for €1,090 that came with a screen, a printer and a mouse. She also bought a scanner for €157, a CD recorder for €74, and a printer for €102.

Sandra's neighbor would give her a can of eggs, which contained nine pounds of eggs, for every time she helped her daughter, Sandra would need three pounds of eggs to make a Spanish pancake. If Sandra was assigned to make 15 Spanish pancakes for a school charity, how many times would Sandra have to help her neighbor's daughter?
Seth is twice as old as Brooke, so in two years, their combined lifespan will be 28 years.
Jimmy has twice as much money as Ethel has, which is $2. If Ethel has $8, how much money does Jimmy have?
Pancho walks 20 miles a day, except on weekends he walks 10 miles.
The military ordered a new uniform, with each uniform coming with a $25 hat, a three-piece jacket, and pants that averaged the price of the hat and jacket.
Jake was walking through the museum of geology, and he saw 80 spiders, each with eight legs, 90 mosquitoes, each with six legs, and three rare mutant invertebrates, each with 10 legs.

If the cabbage has four birds, Sally Two is three years older than Granny Red, Granny Red is twice as old as Sally Four, if Sally Four is the same age as Sally Thirtytwo and Sally Thirtytwo is eight years old, how old are all four birds?

Jessica tries to figure out how much she's going to pay off all of her debts each month, her student loans have a $300/month limit, her credit cards have a $200/month limit, and her mortgage is $500/month.

Billy was peeling and chopping potatoes to prepare the potato salad for his big family barbecue, which was a big event, so he prepared 60 potatoes, and they were about the same size, so it took about the same amount of time to peel and chop each potato.

Juan and Carlos, his brother, were selling lemonade at $3 a gallon for lemonade and $2 for sugar, and they were selling a glass for $0.50 and selling 20 glasses a gallon, so if they made a profit of $25, how much did they buy?
In a tournament with 240 Asians, 80 Japanese, and the rest Chinese, if the number of boys in the Chinese team is 60, how many girls are in the Chinese team?

Sad spends a quarter of his salary paying rent, a third paying gas, and half of the rest he donates to his favorite charity, giving his daughter $200 for her weekly expenses and his wife $700 to fund her groceries and other household items.
If Ronnie has 10 more cards than Monica, Monica has 4 fewer cards than Bo, if Bo has 40 cards, then count the total number of cards that all three of them have combined.
Lloyd gets $10 an hour for doing math, he teaches five hours the first week, eight hours the second week, so what's the total amount he made in the first two weeks?
Two candidates ran for class representation in a school in Sarai, if the winner gets three-quarters of the votes, and the voting class has 80 students, count the votes the loser gets.

Sandra, a local florist, was particularly unhappy with Fred's incomplete delivery. She ordered four times as many red roses as white carnations. She also ordered 200 pink cacalli lilies, five times as many white carnations. Sandra threatened to change the air supply if she did not deliver the missing red roses by 5:00 p.m.
Young is two years older than Mark. Two years ago, Mark was more than half as old as Jan. Five years. If he's 30 now, how old is Jung?

Two teams of sprinters are competing in the 4x400-meter relay, a race in which each team has four members who each run 400 meters or one lap of the standard sprint. One of these teams is the best, with each member running the 400 meters in exactly 55 seconds, the other less than the best. The first runner of the team runs the 400 meters in 60 seconds, then each runner who follows is three seconds faster than the runner before him, based on how many seconds the team that is faster will win.
Jerry is rolling a six-sided die, the probability (expressed as a percentage) that he rolls a higher number than three is greater than the probability that he rolls two consecutive even numbers.
Jenna and her mom pick apples from the apple farm, and Jenna gets half of what her mom gets, so if her mom gets 20 apples, how many apples do they both get?

Russell works at a pet store and he's distributing fangs to the various rodents, and he's keeping mice in three cages, divided equally, so each mouse has six fangs, and there's a separate cage of hamsters, 10 of them, and each hamster has five fangs, and there's a rabbit's foot, and he's distributing 20 fangs to all the rabbits, and he doesn't have to distribute any more fangs in the store, and if he distributes 160 fangs to all the small rodents, there's four cubs in each cage.
Mandy owed Benedict $100, and they agreed to pay 2% interest per month if Mandy could pay the debt in three months, so how much should she pay Benedict?

A merchant buys a certain amount of grain from a farmer for $20 a bag. If each bag of grain from the farm to the warehouse costs $2 and the merchant makes a total profit of $400 after selling each bag at $30 a bag, how many bags of grain did he sell?

Three friends spent $20.25 on three tickets to the show, they spent less on food than they did on $4.50 tickets, and they got to sit on two different machines, paying $33 for each game, if they agreed to split the total cost equally between each person.
John collects peaches for three hours, and he can collect two peaches per minute.
A duck needs to eat 3.5 pounds of insects per week to survive, and if there's a flock of 10 ducks, how many pounds of insects does the flock need to eat in a day?
Tom plants 10 trees a year, and every year he cuts down two trees, too. He starts by planting 50 trees, and after 10 years, 30 percent of the trees are dead. How many trees will he have left?

Sue lives in a fun neighborhood, and one weekend, her neighbor decided to play a prank on her. On Friday morning, the neighbor put 18 pink flamingos in Sue's front yard. On Saturday morning, the neighbor put a third of the flamingos back in white, and then put the newly painted white flamingos back in Sue's front yard. Then on Sunday morning, they added 18 more pink flamingos to the collection. By noon on Sunday, there were four pink flamingos out of the white flamingos.
Violeta wants to buy a new candle, she wants five colors of candle, and she has the money to buy $20 of it, and the color is $2 per candle, so how much money does she get?
A pencil and eraser cost the same as a pencil and eraser combined. A pencil is $1.20 and a eraser is $0.30. How much would eight pencils cost?
200 pounds of carrots were distributed to 40 restaurants in one city, with each restaurant getting 2 pounds of carrots, how many pounds of carrots were left unused?
In Sodami, there are 23,786 inhabitants, consisting of 8,417 men and 9,092 women, the rest of the population being children.

The first month, Ellen had 20 Pokemon cards, and after a month, she had three times that number of cards, the second month, she had fewer cards than she had in the first month, 20 Pokemon cards, the third month, she had twice the number of Pokemon cards she had in the first month and the second month combined, so now she has how many Pokemon cards?

Mark was the original editor, he checked out the same number of revisions to two different publications each week, each paying him a different rate per sentence; Publication B paid Mark twice as much as Publication A. Mark checked out 1,000 sentences a week, and Publication A paid him 5 cents a sentence.
Baldur pumped water from a well, he pumped five buckets every morning and six buckets every afternoon. If each bucket had five liters of water, how many liters could he pump?

John got a bonus from work, this bonus was a one-time $5000 bonus and a 5% raise if he made $2000 a week every week for a year and he got this bonus on the first day of the year, how much money did he make that year?
Josie grows grapes on her 10-acre farm, where each acre produces five tons of grapes a year, and each ton of grapes produces two barrels of wine.

Carl's favorite food is cheese. This week he ate one sandwich for lunch every day and put two slices of cheese in each sandwich. He ate a cheese egg for breakfast three days a week, putting more cheese in the cheese egg than in the sandwich. He made a big cheese macaroni for dinner for several days a week, putting eight slices of cheese in it.
Janet had 22 green pens and 10 yellow pens, and then she bought six bags of blue pens and two bags of red pens, and each bag of blue pens had nine pens and each bag of red pens had six pens.

Brinley was in Cuthbert's math class, and Cuthbert would give her six tests per term, allowing her to subtract the lowest score from the average score for each term. If Brinley scored 89, 71, 92, 100, and 86 on the first five tests, how many points would she need to score on the sixth test to get an average of 93 points?

Michael loved to ride his bike, he rode his bike at least five times a week, and each time he did 25 kilometers, and he did that for four weeks, and then he decided that he would only cycle twice a week, but he would cycle 60 kilometers, and he did that for three weeks.

Joey's Halloween cake bag contains 25 bars of chocolate and 80 sugar-coated apples, each bar of chocolate weighing twice as much as one bar of sugar-coated apples. If each bar of chocolate weighs 40 grams, how many grams of cake would Joe's cake weigh?

Rose goes to the store on Monday and buys four pieces of cake, on Tuesday she goes to another store and buys three times as many cakes, on Wednesday she goes to another store and buys five times as many cakes as she bought on Tuesday, and in three days, how many cakes did she buy?
Twenty cups are less than the total price of half a dozen plates, which sold for $6,000 at $1,200.

Sarah wants to buy herself a new jacket and two pairs of shoes. The jacket she wants costs $30, the shoes cost $20 each. Sarah helps babysit four neighborhood kids, earning $5 for each babysitting. Her parents give her $4 for each lawn she cuts. If Sarah had $10 saved up before she started babysitting, how many lawn cuts would she have to do to buy the jacket and shoes?
Jerry has a flock of chickens, and the red chickens lay three eggs a day, and the white chickens lay five eggs a day, and every day Jerry collects 42 eggs.
Gary likes to walk around the edge of the local park, which is a rectangle of cloth measuring 1.5 miles by 6 miles. If he walked at 3 miles per hour, how many hours would it take him to walk?

At a dollar store, Sloan counts 100 customers coming in, and the next day she counts 50 more than the first day, so if the total is 500 customers by the third day, how many customers does she count on the third day?

Jerry has two pools, both leaking four gallons a minute, and four minutes ago, the big pool had twice the amount of water than the small pool, and now the big pool has four times the amount of water than the small pool.
Lori wants to buy $320 shoes and $320 seat belts, part-time work that pays her $8 an hour, how many hours of work does she have to do to afford these things?
Janet borrowed $2,000 and promised to pay back 10% of the money if she paid $165 a month for 12 months, and by then, how much money would Janet have left?
In the bouquet there are four roses, more roses than seven roses.
Adrian is three times older than Harriet, and Harriet is half as young as Zach. If Harriet is 21 now, calculate the average age of all three over the next three years.
The four students scored a total of 251 points in the board game, with Naomi scoring 68, Yuri scoring more than half of Naomi's 10 points, and Brianna scoring more than Naomi's 17 points.
Carmen takes 10 minutes to do a puzzle and 5 minutes to complete a sudoku, and over the weekend, she solves 3 puzzles and 8 sudoku.
A single tank holds 120 liters of water, and Selene uses the water from a 90-liter tank to water her little garden, so she can store twice as much rainwater as she has left.
Andy planted 90 geraniums and 40 less geraniums, and how many flowering plants did he grow?

A company spends $15,000 on advertising for one year, then spends a third of that on advertising for another year, and then two years later, what's the total amount of advertising that company spends?

Carlos and Benji are on the beach, Carlos rents a canoe for $30 an hour, Benji rents a pampana for $18 an hour, so if Carlos uses the boat for three hours and Benji uses the pad for five hours, how much do they pay in rent altogether?

Andrew planned a road trip from New Jersey to Rochester, which would take six days to travel by bus and half a day to travel by car from New Jersey to Rochester. If he planned to travel to Rochester by bus and back from Rochester by car, how many days would it take him to travel?

James is counting his Pokémon cards, he has 30 fire elements, 20 grass elements, and 40 water elements, so if he makes 8 missing water elements and buys 14 grass elements, what is the percentage chance that he will get water elements (the remainder being the nearest whole number)?

Chad ordered a custom-made burrito for lunch, with the basic burrito for $6.50; he added the meat for $2.00, added the cheese for $1.00, added the avocado for $1.00, and added two sauces for $0.25 each; he decided to upgrade his meal for an additional $3.00, which would add fries and drinks; he had a $5.00 gift card that expired at checkout; how much more did he have to pay?

Kalinda is doing 360 jigsaw puzzles with her mother, and Kalinda can usually do four puzzles per minute, and Kalinda's mother can do more than her in half a minute, so it would take two more hours to finish this puzzle.

One field of mangoes produced 120 mangoes. Ashlyn went to the field after two months and found that 30 percent of the mangoes were ready for harvesting, so she took them home when she returned to the field two weeks later, but the other three-quarters were ready. She harvested those mangoes. How many were not ready for harvest after two weeks?
Mark bought 12 cars for his company, each sold for $20,000, paid 10% vehicle tax, and paid $1,000 for each car's registration fee, so what did he pay in total?

Kyle and Robert like to go to the beach to collect seagulls. On Monday, Kyle collects more seagulls than Robert, who collects 20 seagulls in five sets. On Tuesday, Kyle collects twice as many seagulls as he collects on Monday.
Dax goes to the farm to pick apples and finds more than half the insects in the garden. If there are 50 ants, count the number of insects in the garden.
There were 36 penguins sunbathing in the snow, then a third of them jumped into the sea to swim, while another third went to dinner in the cave, so how many penguins were still sunbathing?
Steve decided to start eating more tomatoes and decided to grow his own cherry tomatoes, which he surprisingly ate twice as much as his girlfriend, eating six tomatoes a day.
John ordered a pizza to share with his friends, who were 20, and John wanted to make sure that each of them would get four pieces, which would be sold in eight pieces.

Ram was a pen user, and he found that he could save money by combining five empty pens into one full pen. If he bought 25 pens and brought them back to make new pens when the pen was almost out, how many pens would he have?
Johnny took out $20 of his alimony and added another $10 and then he put it into an investment, which tripled in one year, so how much money did he have after one year?
Mary is two years younger than John, and John is five years older than Jessica. If Jessica is 20, how old are all three women combined?

In a school auditorium with 1,000 students, there are three entrances, A, B and C, which are also used as exits. If after the meeting, 30% of the students leave the building using exit A, the remaining three-fifths exit B, and the rest exit C, then calculate the number of students who leave the building using exit C.
James has six more apples than Robert, and John has twice as many apples as Robert.
Dolly has two books, Pandora has one book, and if Dolly and Pandora both read each other's books, including their own, how many books would they end up reading together?

Mike had five pen pals, and then he broke off the pen pals with those two, and each of the other guys sent him two letters a week, five pages each, and he wrote back in a friendly way, and he could write a page every six minutes, and he would write for how many hours a week.
Jason has a package of 1,000 minutes of phone calls a month, where he's going to talk to his boss for 15 minutes a day, and then spend 300 minutes of this month talking to other people.

Griffin had 24 fries, but Kyle had five, and Billy had twice as many as Kyle, and Ginger had a handful of fries for Griffin, and Colby had three fewer fries than Griffin, and if Griffin had 27 fries, then how many fries did Ginger have for Griffin?

In one tank, there are four trawlers, and in the other tank, there are 32 trawlers, and the difference between the number of trawlers in two tanks is twice the number of fish in both tanks, if the two tanks have the same number of fish, each tank has two fish.

A Chinese makeup artist was paid $250 an hour, and she had to wear expensive makeup to get into the movie she was in, which took six hours of makeup a day, and she had to do it four times a week, and the movie was shot in five weeks.

Isabel bought her little sister's birthday party, where she spent $12 on the cake, $43 on the birthday present, $15 on the decorations, $4 on the invitation cards, and $22 on the hospital bags for the guests who came to the party. She split the cost with her parents, three of them, equally. How much did each of them pay?
The chef buys four bags of dumplings, each bag weighing 50 pounds, one pound of dumplings for $1.50.
On Monday, Sukin eats four times as many cookies as her sister, on Tuesday, she eats twice as many cookies as her sister, and her sister eats five cookies on Monday, and 13 cookies on the next day.
